title: Lung Injury Prediction Score (LIPS)
description: Identifies patients at high risk for developing acute lung injury (ALI)

ranges.description: Low risk for acute lung injury
ranges.interpretation: Low risk for developing acute lung injury. Standard monitoring and care. ALI development unlikely but continue routine clinical assessment.

ranges.description: High risk for acute lung injury
ranges.interpretation: High risk for developing acute lung injury. Implement preventive strategies including lung-protective ventilation, conservative fluid management, and close monitoring.

references: Gajic O, Dabbagh O, Park PK, Adesanya A, Chang SY, Hou P, et al. Early identification of patients at risk of acute lung injury: evaluation of lung injury prediction score in a multicenter cohort study. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2011 Feb 15;183(4):462-70. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201004-0549OC.

Kor DJ, Warner DO, Alsara A, Fernández-Pérez ER, Malinchoc M, Kashyap R, et al. Derivation and diagnostic accuracy of the surgical lung injury prediction model. Anesthesiology. 2011 Jul;115(1):117-28. doi: 10.1097/ALN.0b013e31821b5839.

Trillo-Alvarez C, Cartin-Ceba R, Kor DJ, Kojicic M, Kashyap R, Thakur S, et al. Acute lung injury prediction score: derivation and validation in a population-based sample. Eur Respir J. 2011 Mar;37(3):604-9. doi: 10.1183/09031936.00036810.
formula: LIPS = Sum of predisposing conditions + high-risk surgery + high-risk trauma + risk modifiers. Shock (2), Aspiration (2), Sepsis (1), Pneumonia (1.5), Pancreatitis (1), Surgery (1-3.5), Trauma (1.5-2), Risk modifiers (1-2 each), Diabetes with sepsis (-1).
notes: Developed to identify patients at risk for acute lung injury before mechanical ventilation
Validated in multicenter cohort studies with over 5,000 patients
Score >4 points identifies high-risk patients requiring preventive measures
Positive likelihood ratio 3.1, negative likelihood ratio 0.4
ALI typically develops within 2 days (median) of initial assessment
Emergency Department version (EDLIPS) also available with similar performance
Should be calculated within 24 hours of hospital admission or ICU transfer
Useful for enrollment in ALI prevention trials and clinical protocols
Does not replace clinical judgment but aids in risk stratification
Pancreatitis has lowest ALI risk (3%) while smoke inhalation has highest (26%)
Score helps guide implementation of lung-protective strategies early
